pr_title: Add support for Undertow server runtime

timeline.message: Add support for Undertow server runtime

timeline.body:
I don't think we generally perform this check (maybe we should?)
```suggestion
          scope = attachedContext.makeCurrent();
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
I don't think we generally perform this check (maybe we should?)

Suggested change
if (!Java8BytecodeBridge.currentContext().equals(attachedContext)) {
scope = attachedContext.makeCurrent();
}
scope = attachedContext.makeCurrent();

replies.bodyText: This is similar to rescoping check in Servlet3. If there is server context attached to the request and it differs from the current context, then we rescope into server context. If they are the same, no point in calling makeCurrent, is it?

timeline.body:
two thoughts:
* a bootstrap class can't really reference the AttachmentKey class, the reason this is working is because of erasure, but think better to not hide that, and use Object here in the signature
* I think better to use `Map<ClassLoader, Object>` (where the value is AttachmentKey), in case undertow _itself_ is loaded by two different class loaders, in which case you really do need two different AttachmentKey instances. The key of the map would be `AttachmentKey.class.getClassLoader()`.

timeline.bodyHTML:
two thoughts:

  • a bootstrap class can't really reference the AttachmentKey class, the reason this is working is because of erasure, but think better to not hide that, and use Object here in the signature
  • I think better to use Map<ClassLoader, Object> (where the value is AttachmentKey), in case undertow itself is loaded by two different class loaders, in which case you really do need two different AttachmentKey instances. The key of the map would be AttachmentKey.class.getClassLoader().

This means that we cannot hold an instance of {@link AttachmentKey} in a static field + * of the corresponding Tracer, as we usually do. Tracers are loaded into user's classloaders and + * thus it is totally possible to have several instances of tracers. Each of those instances will + * have a separate value in a static field and {@link HttpServerExchange} will treat them as + * different keys then. + * + *

That is why this class exists and resides in a separate package. This package is treated in a + * special way and is always loaded by bootstrap classloader. This makes sure that this class is + * available to all tracers from every classloader. + * + *

Class has to be loaded by any classloader that + * has it, e.g. by the classloader of a Tracer that uses this key holder. After that, all + * Tracers, loaded by all classloaders, will be able to use exactly the same sole instance of the + * key. + */ +public class KeyHolder { + public static final AtomicReference> contextKey = new AtomicReference<>();

replies.bodyText: How about a map from class to object to allow scaling this to any type? WeakMap<Class<?>, Object>. And since classes from different classloaders aren't equal (I presume), wouldn't need ClassLoader in the key I believe.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: ya, I like that, it's approximately "contextStore" for a single static field
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
Why do I want two different key instance if Undertow is loaded from two different classloaders? And how is the latter possible?
Important point is that any given request must use the same key all the time it passes through Undertow and WildFly.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
It's not going to happen in wildfly, since wildfly provides undertow in its root class loader, but it's possible, e.g. say you had two tomcat apps that each included undertow library.
And if you have two class loaders each with their own copy of undertow classes, and if you store an AttachmentKey from one class loader into the AtomicReference, and read it back out from the other class loader and cast it to AttachmentKey you will get ClassCastException.

replies.bodyText: Now I understand :) Thank you for your patience :)
